TITLE: Initializing MarkerArea and Adding to DOM
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code to create a MarkerArea instance, set its target image, and add it to the DOM. This sets up the annotation editor.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ailon/markerjs3/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const markerArea = new MarkerArea();
markerArea.targetImage = targetImg;
editorContainerDiv.appendChild(markerArea);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Rendering Static Annotation Image with marker.js 3
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code to create a Renderer instance, rasterize the annotation state, and display the result as an image. This demonstrates how to generate static annotated images.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ailon/markerjs3/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const renderer = new Renderer();
renderer.targetImage = targetImg;
const dataUrl = await renderer.rasterize(markerArea.getState());

const img = document.createElement('img');
img.src = dataUrl;

someDiv.appendChild(img);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using MarkerView for Dynamic Annotation Display
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code to import, initialize, and use MarkerView for displaying dynamic annotation overlays on top of the original image. This shows how to create a viewer for annotations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ailon/markerjs3/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { MarkerView } from '@markerjs/markerjs3';

const markerView = new MarkerView();
markerView.targetImage = targetImg;
viewerContainer.appendChild(markerView);

markerView.show(savedState);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Saving Annotation State in marker.js 3
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code to add an event listener that saves the current annotation state when a button is clicked. The state is logged to the console.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ailon/markerjs3/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
document.querySelector('#saveStateButton')?.addEventListener('click', () => {
  const state = markerArea.getState();
  console.log(state);
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a New Marker in marker.js 3
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code to add an event listener that creates a new FrameMarker when a button is clicked. This demonstrates how to initiate marker creation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ailon/markerjs3/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
document.querySelector('#addButton')?.addEventListener('click', () => {
  markerArea.createMarker('FrameMarker');
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing MarkerArea from marker.js 3
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code to import the MarkerArea class from the marker.js 3 library. This is the main component for creating the annotation editor.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ailon/markerjs3/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { MarkerArea } from '@markerjs/markerjs3';
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing Renderer for Static Image Generation
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code to import both MarkerArea and Renderer from marker.js 3. Renderer is used to create static images of annotations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ailon/markerjs3/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { MarkerArea, Renderer } from '@markerjs/markerjs3';
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing marker.js 3 via npm
DESCRIPTION: Command to install marker.js 3 using npm package manager. The library includes TypeScript type definitions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ailon/markerjs3/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install @markerjs/markerjs3
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating an HTML Image Element in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code to create an HTMLImageElement and set its source. This is used as a target image for annotation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ailon/markerjs3/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const targetImg = document.createElement('img');
targetImg.src = './sample.jpg';
```
